title: Moving on
content:
What is it with us Keeners and difficult situations? I need to take some time away from... well, everything, including Keen. I'd like to take a break from existing for a while, but alas it is not a possibility.

There's a huge void in my life that I've long distracted myself from though my so-called dreams and aspirations. However, because of these very things my relationship is toast, and I'm becoming more and more recluse. I need to bring myself back into the moment.

I don't know what the next step is, but I've got a lot to sort out in my head. If I keep working on Keen stuff, or in fact anything to do with computers, I'll just be distracting myself for a while and it'll all collapse again, but worse.

My mods and editing tools are thus cancelled until further notice, and I shall be AFK (though I may follow this thread for a short time).

I will return, but I can't say when. If you need to contact me for any reason, use the email address in my profile or catch me on MSN, which I'll leave signed in when I can.

jiofe' and Keen On.

title: Re: Moving on
content:
Bye. Come back soon but I know these things take time.

Well until then! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I will miss your posts and funny IMs.-----------------------

title: Re: Moving on
content:
I will enjoy your break, I had a lot of you related work now I can take a rest.

Pity to see you go, hope to see you back.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Moving on
content:
Just a note to everyone else here, you don't necessarily need to be successful or happy/comfortable with your life to hang out on these forums.
But sometimes a break from the internet can help put your focus back onto other aspects of your life that need it, as Spleen is doing.

There was a time when I stopped visiting the PCKF, but it wasn't deliberate... I just drifted away when things other than Keen took my focus. But now I'm back, mainly for the community rather than to get into more Keen projects (apart from Strifetoons, hehe). You Keeners're kewl. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: Moving on
content:
Well I wish you all the best, and don't you dare not to come back.-----------------

title: Re: Moving on
content:
Man, I'll miss you!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Hopefully you'll be back soon, and get things sorted out.. 'jiofe!

Well, at least I can now sleep a little longer (whenever I return home), for a while, and not try to wake up before 6 pm in order to try to catch Spleen at (Finnish) daytime.. Nah, I rather be up earlier and chat with you! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

"Just a note to everyone else here, you don't necessarily need to be successful or happy/comfortable with your life to hang out on these forums."
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] Well.. DUH! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] That is why I still hang out on these forums! (joke)

And finally, what do I do in problematic situations? Naturally depends on situation, but if it's some human stuff (as partly or entirely in this case, I gather, as you mentioned something about a relationship), I don't have any other experience than just waiting till something good happens or alternatively losing a buddy.. (Which seems to have happened a few times, although not directly because of any sudden rage/fight/argument.)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Moving on
content:
I never quite understood what jiofe meant, but now might be a good time to say it.

So, jiofe.

Hope you come back soon, Spleen.
